title: Urinary incontinence is common among people attending pulmonary rehabilitation, yet pulmonary rehabilitation has a small effect on urinary symptoms: A multicenter prospective cohort study.
abstract: Urinary incontinence (UI) is common among individuals with chronic respiratory diseases (CRDs) and may limit attendance, completion, and response to pulmonary rehabilitation (PR). This study aims to assess what is the prevalence of UI among individuals attending PR, and how does PR affect UI and other clinical outcomes, and if UI is associated with PR completion and response.
